grounds all your your learning because
when you learn about some new classifier
it's also a lot more interesting because
it's like oh this could help me do what
I want to do thanks and our next
question is what is the goal of your
research into creative AI sure so the
way I like to think about it is that
machine learning is a really good
approach to taking a situation where you
you have a solution that you're trying
to get and then you can set up an
algorithm such that it tries to find
it's like searching for the optimal

but often
there's not a real many times in the
world it's not really clear how to
quantify what is it that we want
optimized you know there's a lot of
problems that are more open-ended and
socially and contextually dependent and
all that type of stuff so that's sort of
one of the interesting areas where
creativity comes in because that's a

and the cultural context of the
listeners and all these things where you
want an algorithm just to sort of
augment the abilities of someone you

even know they had and these types of

that means something very dependent on

we see ourselves is where a research

algorithms that we're interested in
looking at so great Thanks and our user

our next question comes to review or
media Chris who asks how do you teach an
algorithm mm-hmm yeah so we use the word
teach but there's really no
it's just a metaphor right there's
really no teaching involved another
another way we could think of it is
searching you know that you can imagine
writing an algorithm that you give it
let's say needs to find the best
solution you give it a hundred choices
you can try all a hundred choices and
you give it a metric to say like you
know evaluate whether or not this is
good and so you can try all hundred
choices and if say oh this one is good
so what we're doing a sort of an
expanded version of that where the the
definition of what is good depends on
the data that we present it so we might
say do a good job of of coming up with a
set of rules that that describes this
data but these rules are not hard-coded
rules like if this then that they're
more soft rules so they're like if
you've seen these ten notes in the past
like that um then give me a probability
the next note will be this note or that
you know and then I'll choose from that
probability to actually generate the
next sound so how we actually train the
algorithm is we generate a whole we
collect a whole bunch of data that is
the type of data that we're interested
in modeling so it might be a specific
type of music or a specific type of like
melodies or drums or something and then
we use software that Google as open
source called tensorflow that basically
sets up a whole possible set of
computations to connect to to make that
prediction given these notes what's the
next note that all predict and then the
algorithm searches through the whole
space of all the possible functions that
could map from this inputs to that
output until it finds sort of finds the
best best solution that it can find and
the the analogy is you can imagine it's
sort of like you know like a slope or
something where the if a good solution
is one that's really low down and what
we have sort of the way we do the search
is sort of equivalent to like doing a
little simulation of physics where we
just were going to make
solution Traverse down the hill to find
the basin of the most likely in the best
the best solution of how it maps the
inputs the outputs and you know there's
more details about how we do that using
back propagation and chain rule and
these types of things but in essence
that's the idea is it's basically we set
up a possible set of functions and then
we find the best function to map the
things so there's a lot of human choices
there there's the choices of what David
do we use what's what's what are gonna
be the controls at the end that the
human is gonna be able to control and
how do we set up the space of possible
functions that they can search through
and how do we set it up so it actually
searches through that and then and then
we let it do the search and it usually
doesn't work very well so then we have
to tweak the parameters and try again
and tweak the parameters and try again
so that's that's my day job that's what
we do it sounds like a fun day job so
